name: LIVE - Simmons Post Call Flow - Owner Edu/Andy

parameters.subject: =Hi, your call with Leonard was too short.
parameters.bodyContent:
=

Hi {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }},

Unfortunately, our call about your matter was too short for me to capture what I needed.

Please call back here to restart the conversation.

Thanks,
Leonard

parameters.subject: =Hi, {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }} here is the summary of our conversation
parameters.bodyContent:
=

Hi {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }},

Here’s your matter summary based on our conversation:

{{ $json.matter.heading }}
D1 Name of client – this will be publishable. If you cannot reveal the client’s name, give a general description.
{{ $json.matter.D1.client_name }}
D2 Summary of matter and your department's role – Please say why this matter was important. Also, tell us exactly what role your department played.
{{ $json.matter.D2.formatted_output }}
D3 Matter value – include currency and amount in figures
{{ $json.matter.D3.formatted_output }}
D4 Is this a cross-border matter? If yes, please indicate the jurisdictions involved.
{{ $json.matter.D4.formatted_output }}
D5 Lead lawyer
{{ $json.matter.D5.formatted_output }}
D6 Other team members
{{ $json.matter.D6.formatted_output }}
D7 Other firms advising on the matter and their role(s)
{{ $json.matter.D7.formatted_output }}
D8 Date of completion or current status
{{ $json.matter.D8.formatted_output }}
D9 Other information about this matter – e.g. link to press coverage
{{ $json.matter.D9.formatted_output }}
{{ $json.data }}

That’s everything for now — hope it was helpful. If you’d like to log another matter straight away, you can do it here.

Cheers,

Leonard

AI Assistant
Legal Engine

E: leonard@legalengine.co.uk
W: www.legalengine.co.uk

© 2025 Legal Engine Ltd. All rights reserved.

Unsubscribe

parameters.text: =*Short Simmons conversation with {{ $('11L Airtable Capture').item.json.fields['Full Name'] }}
=*Very Short Simmons conversation with {{ $('11L Airtable Capture').item.json.fields['Full Name'] }}

assignments.name: fladgate_tone_of_voice
assignments.value:
Firm-Specific Tone, Style and Formatting Guide (Chambers-Compatible)
Overall Tone

Professional, neutral and evidence-driven.

Clean, precise prose that supports Chambers’ preference for narrative clarity.

Plain English, minimal adjectives, no hype.

Every sentence must advance significance, complexity or impact.

No em dashes. Use a full stop to start a new sentence, or a comma to continue.

Foundational Style Rules

UK English throughout.

Always use third person.

Short sentences.

Avoid rhetorical devices or idioms.

Use consistent formatting across all submissions.

Referencing Conventions
Clients

Default to anonymisation unless public.

Use a descriptive identifier on first mention and a shorter form afterwards.

Example: “A high-net-worth individual with global business interests” → “the client”.

Dates

Use DD Month YYYY.

Ranges: January to March 2025, 14 September 2024 to 12 January 2025.

Matter Value

Always include currency and figures in a clear, Chambers-friendly format.

Examples from E3 (to be followed precisely):

£30 million – £40 million

If a narrower range exists: £7m – £9m

If a single amount: £15,000

Use decimals only where meaningful: £40.5m.

For multi-currency: £40m (approx USD 50m).

Cross-Border Jurisdictions

If the matter is cross-border, clearly list all relevant jurisdictions.

Follow the E4 example format:

Yes, Sweden, France and the UK. Historic property held in New York, USA. Business interests in multiple jurisdictions. Trusts held in BVI before being moved to Liechtenstein.

Rules for the AI agent:

List jurisdictions cleanly, separated by commas or full stops.

Include historic locations where relevant to complexity.

Avoid narrative commentary — only facts.

Lawyer Referencing (Internal Team)

Use this strict order for every person:

Full name

Title

Practice Group

Firm (if needed)

Lead Lawyer Format (E5 example):

Hetty Gleave (Partner, Matrimonial)

Other Team Members Format (E6 example):

The AI must follow this pattern exactly:

Rebecca Christie (Senior Associate, Matrimonial, Fladgate), Jonathan Riley (Partner, Matrimonial, Fladgate), Elizabeth Clarke (‘Star individual’ junior counsel, QEB), Amy Kisser (Band 1 junior counsel, QEB), James Ewins KC (Band 1 silk, QEB), Alexander Thorpe KC, Jessica O’Driscoll Breen, Andrew Campbell (all barristers at QEB)

Formatting rules derived from this example:

Use commas to separate individuals.

Include titles and rankings where known.

If several barristers are at the same chambers, you may group them (“all barristers at QEB”).

KC/King’s Counsel is always appended to the name.

Rankings should appear in parentheses.

Other Firms and Counsel (E7 Example Standards)

Follow this precise structure for external advisers:

James Stewart (Partner) and Amy Fox (Partner), Penningtons Manches Cooper LLP (UHNW firm)
Deborah Bangay KC and Lily Mottahedan (Family: Matrimonial Finance), 1 Hare Court
Emma Hargreaves (Serle Court)

Formatting rules for the AI:

Start with full names.

Include titles where relevant.

End with the firm/chambers name.

If multiple advisers share the same set, place the set at the end.

No adjectives except Chambers/Legal 500 ranking terminology.

Matter Headline

Format:
Client name or identifier. Core issue
Examples:

“A high-net-worth client. Multi-jurisdictional divorce and trust restructuring”

“A global commodities group. High-value fraud and arbitration defence”

Matter Structure (Chambers-Compatible Narrative)

Every matter must follow this mini-case-study arc:

Client and Context

Concise description, anonymity where required.

Jurisdiction(s).

Nature of the matter.

Challenge and Complexity

Core legal, commercial or procedural issues.

Cross-border, regulatory, trust, or multi-party considerations.

Quantified value using the E3 format.

Strategy and Role

Team actions, critical decisions, innovative approaches.

Use active verbs.

Avoid promotional adjectives.

Outcome and Impact

Results achieved.

What was protected, won, avoided or unlocked.

Why it matters in the Chambers sense (precedent, strategic value).

Lawyers Involved

Follow E5 and E6 formats precisely.

Other Firms / Counsel Involved (if relevant)

Follow the E7 pattern.

Long Summary / Practice Overview

Firm preference: structured prose, short paragraphs, consistent with Chambers’ narrative expectations and Legal 500’s clarity principles.

Required order:

Overview of practice strengths.

Themes across the past year.

Integrated examples of high-impact matters.

Team depth, leadership and next-generation capability.

Market positioning and innovations.

What to avoid:

Bullet-point lists unless the directory template requires them.

Marketing superlatives not supported by evidence.

Long paragraphs without clear narrative direction.

Integration With Chambers Best Practice

This guide does not replace guidance in GUIDELINES 1–2.
It provides operational instructions so the AI agent outputs text that is:

stylistically consistent,

compliant with templates,

aligned with narrative storytelling requirements,

compatible with confidentiality and referee expectations,

formatted correctly (names, titles, values, jurisdictions),

suitable for immediate insertion into Chambers and Legal 500 forms.
